comment._content: www.smithsonianmag.com/history-archaeology/pietown.html?c... Great article with the history of Pie Town inspired by these photographs.

comment.author: 9856720@N04
comment._content: i did a series of paintings from this photo( and other russell lee shots) last summer. not only are these pictures beautiful but they add insight into the hardships of the dustbowl and depression. it is great that the library of congress is doing this.

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This image has been used in the indicommons.org post Happy First Birthday, Commons — for the pie!

comment.author: 15782250@N00
comment._content:
My girlfriend and I drove through Pie Town, NM, on Rt. 60 on December 29, 2008, which was just before I stumbled across this series of photos. We had just left the VLA Observatory and were on our way to Meteor Crater, AZ and I only managed to get one photo:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/unclejefejefe/3490083712/]

To be honest, I didn't even know the place existed until seeing it on the map while driving but was thrilled to see these wonderful photos soon after passing through.

Plus, I'm happy to actually see pies in the Pie Town photographs!

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content:
Pie is good :)

And I'm glad this popped up again - I was just reading about the Pie Town photographs recently, and I'll have to track down where that was again.

comment.author: 92968967@N00
comment._content: This is the central piece I'm painting this summer. I love these photos. pietownscroll.wordpress.com/
